Authors:
Dennis E. Desjardin, Scott T. Bates, Robert W.
Roberson
Title:
Arizona gasteroid fungi I: Lycoperdaceae (Agaricales,
Basidiomycota).
Abstract:
Twenty-eight species in the family Lycoperdaceae, commonly
called puffballs, are reported from Arizona, USA. In addition to widely
distributed species, understudied species (e.g., Calvatia cf.Â leiospora
and Holocotylon brandegeeanum) are treated. Taxonomic descriptions and
illustrations, which include microscopic characters, are given for each
species, and a dichotomous key is presented to facilitate
identification. Basidiospore morphology was also examined
ultrastructurally using scanning electron microscopy, and phylogenetic
analyses were carried out on nrRNA gene sequences (ITS1, ITS2, and 5.8S)
from 42 species within (or closely allied to) the Lycoperdaceae.
